newsitem.title: USA: Kansas feedlot cattle steady at $67, active - USDA.
newsitem.headline: Kansas feedlot cattle steady at $67, active - USDA.

text.p: Trade active Tuesday morning, quiet afternoon, USDA said.
Slaughter steers and heifers steady. Inquiry good, demand moderate early, light later.

Sales confirmed on 27,100 slaughter steers and 21,300 slaughter heifers Tuesday. For the week to date 61,200 head confirmed including 8,600 head, or about 14 percent previously contracted or formulated cattle. Sales FOB feedlot net weights after 4 percent shrink.

Slaughter steers - Select and Choice 2-3 1075-1250 lbs 67.00; few pens including Select with end Choice cutting bulls 66.00-66.50; pen Select and Choice 1300 lb Holsteins 60.00. Dressed basis - Few Select and Choice 2-3 1200-1225 lbs 107.00-110.00.

Slaughter heifers - Select and Choice 2-3 990-1120 lbs 67.00, couple pens 66.25-66.75; pen Select with end Choice 66.00; few mixed Commercial to Choice 1100 lb heifers and heiferettes 65.50-66.00. Dressed basis - Few Select and Choice 2-3 1075 lbs 107.00.
Wk to date - 61,200 last week - 8,700 last year - 23,500
